trial_identification.studytitle: Sitting posture of children with cerebral palsy: influence of upper limbs support
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Analysis of pressure distribution on the seat of the furniture and static balance in twelve children with cerebral palsy in the sitting position without support and with support of upper limbs in adapted table to analyse the influence of upper limbs support.

interventions.interventions: Data collection was performed once with patient seated on a wheelchair adapted in two situations, during three minutes each situation: without upper limbs support and with their arms supported on an adjusted table. The approximate duration between each situation was 10 minutes. The order to implement each situation was defined by lot. Data were obtained through the program of analysis of pressure sensors Conformat Research pressure mapping system applied.
interventions.comparator: patient sitting on a wheelchair adapted with their arms supported on an adjusted table.

primaryOutcome.timepoint: This outcome was assessed by Conformat Research pressure mapping system applied with the patient sitting on a adapted wheelchair
This outcome was assessed by Conformat Research pressure mapping system applied with the patient sitting on a adapted wheelchair
This outcome was assessed by Conformat Research pressure mapping system applied with the patient sitting on a adapted wheelchair

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Children with spastic cerebral palsy Sorting through the Gross Motor Function System as grade III and IV.

ethicsAndSummary.summary: To analyze the pressure distribution on the seat of the furniture and static balance in children with cerebral palsy in the sitting position without support and with support of upper limbs in adapted table.
